Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the threat posed by a Donald Trump presidency to the global economy by ranking it ahead of terrorism.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that risk analysts listed Donald Trump as one of the top threats facing the global economy.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the rankings by the Economist Intelligence Unit accurately reflect the consensus among risk analysts, which may not be the case.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the rankings, such as different perspectives or methodologies used by the Economist Intelligence Unit.
